TopicTitle: Humans... - so we make crop circles on kerbin now?

Articles.Content:
Hello, guys.

Jeb was taking a casual explo... *ahem* rocket ride over KSC and when he was landing, he noticed this:

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The first one looks suspiciously like the rear parts of the rocket he was just piloting. Therefore I had to convince him that those who did this to Kerbin will be long gone before I get him to space.

"What a pity", he said. "I wonder whether they have jellies..."

When discussing the matter with Wernher, we made only one plausible conclusion (sorry for meme usage, seems fitting):

NASA, don't you want to explain something about that warp drive you've made a decade ago? Ã‚Â¬_Ã‚Â¬

P.S. It was linux x64, heavily modded, it's just natural that the shaders happen...

Am I right when posting that on the general discussion?
Now see this scares me. I'm going to be making the jump to Linux soon just for ksp, but if stuff like this happens...
It happens, but I'm not sure whether that wasn't a little bit a mod problem. X64 ksp on linux is otherwise stabler than anything else imo.
Maybe there is a giant space station orbiting really close to the sun or something?

Maybe there is a giant space station orbiting really close to the sun or something?

I don't recall any. Therefore Humans

Maybe there is a giant space station orbiting really close to the sun or something?

That looks suspiciously like girders and a docking port.

That looks suspiciously like girders and a docking port.

That's what they want you to think. The truth is at Karea 51...
Were the shadows static? Or did they move in some way?

Oh dear, the trypophobia is getting to me.

But that's a really neat glitch, though.
